benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client

Class CrimeDataLoadingFragment<CrimeResultData extends UtvarAndIntervalBasedCrimeSummary & java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client.CrimeDataLoadingFragment<CrimeResultData>
  • Type Parameters:
    CrimeResultData - the crime data type to be loaded by this data loading fragment class
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CrimeDetailLoadingFragment, CrimeListLoadingFragment, CrimeSummaryLoadingFragment, UtvarDetailLoadingFragment

    public abstract class CrimeDataLoadingFragment<CrimeResultData extends UtvarAndIntervalBasedCrimeSummary & java.io.Serializable>
extends Fragment
    CrimeDataLoadingFragment is the abstract base class for all fragments loading a certain type of crime statistics from the CrimeMonitor service.

    A concrete instance of this class is used by an owning activity to perform the crime data loading from the CrimeMonitor service on behalf of the activity.

    This class handles both the crime data loading and maintaining the current location. It notifies the registered CrimeDataLoadingListener about the important data loading events. The location updates are send to KodUtvaruLoadingListener.

    Typically, the GPS location provider is used, the user is prompted to turn the GPS on if not already on.

    Because of this class being the subclass of Fragment, this class instance is normally attached to an instance of an activity, that MUST implement both the CrimeDataLoadingListener and KodUtvaruLoadingListener.

    This fragment is set to be retained across the multiple owning activity instances in order to keep the background data loading tasks running when the user rotates the screen or some other configuration change occurs.

    The owning activity uses this class to request the crime data for a given interval by calling its refreshDataForInterval(int, int, int, int) method. The activity calls refreshDataIfLocationHasChanged() method to force the refresh of the current department info for the current location.

    The class instance holds the current state information:

    • requested time interval for crime data
    • current department data:
      • code
      • location
    • current location
    It also stores the reference to the CrimeMonitor service in mServiceBaseUrl.

    Author:
    Tom

        Constant Field Values

      • mStartYear

        private int mStartYear
        initial crime data interval year

        Crime data interval

        It is meant to represent a real-world time interval.

        This interval starts with a certain initial month (mStartMonth) in a certain initial year (mStartYear) and ends with a certain terminal month (mEndMonth) in a certain terminal year ( mEndYear). Thus it includes the time period between the two months.

        This time period is used to filter the crimes according to the date and time of their occurence.

      • mStartYear_InstanceStateKey

        public static final java.lang.String mStartYear_InstanceStateKey
        implementation detail
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public CrimeDataLoadingFragment(java.net.URL serviceUrl,
                        int startYear,

                        int endMonth)
        The preferred constructor. This constructor is used to initialize the fragment with the CrimeMonitor service base URL and the initial requested crime data interval.
        Parameters:
        serviceUrl - the URL representing the CrimeMonitor service base URL
        startYear - the starting year number for the crime data time interval
        startMonth - the starting month number for the crime data time interval
        endYear - the ending year number for the crime data time interval
        endMonth - the ending month number for the crime data time interval

      • cancelTasks

        public void cancelTasks()

      • clearData

      • createCrimeDataLoadingAsyncTaskHandler

        protected abstract CrimeDataLoadingFragment.CrimeDataLoadingAsyncTaskHandler createCrimeDataLoadingAsyncTaskHandler(int startYear,
                                                                                               int startMonth,
                                                                                               int endYear,
                                                                                               int endMonth,
                                                                                               java.lang.String kodUtvaru,
                                                                                               Location location)
        Creates the crime data loading task wrapper.

        The wrapper is an instance of CrimeDataLoadingFragment.CrimeDataLoadingAsyncTaskHandler which is a helper class that encapsulates the asynchronous task created in createCrimeDataLoadingTask(int, int, int, int, java.lang.String). This helper objects uses this fragment's onCrimeDataLoaded(CrimeResultData, Location), onCrimeDataLoadingCancelled(int, int, int, int, java.lang.String), onCrimeDataLoadingError(int, int, int, int, java.lang.String, java.lang.Exception), onCrimeDataLoadingStarted(), onCrimeDataLoadingTaskCreated() and onCrimeEmptyDataLoaded(int, int, int, int, java.lang.String) protected callback methods to report it's results to this fragment.

        Parameters:
        startYear - the starting year of the crime data time interval
        startMonth - the starting month of the crime data time interval
        endYear - the ending year of the crime data time interval
        endMonth - the ending month of the crime data time interval
        kodUtvaru - the string representing the department code. It conforms to the regular expression [0-9]{6}.
        location - the Location instance with the current department code location
        Returns:
        CrimeDataLoadingAsyncTaskHandler instance of an asynchronous task handler, which encapsulates the data loading asynchronous task created with #createCrimeDataLoadingTask

      • createCrimeDataLoadingTask

        protected abstract GetCrimeDataTask<CrimeResultData> createCrimeDataLoadingTask(int startYear,
                                                           int startMonth,
                                                           int endYear,
                                                           int endMonth,
                                                           java.lang.String kodUtvaru)
        Creates the crime data loading task instance.

        The crime data task is parametrized by the given crime data interval and the department code.

        Parameters:
        startYear - the starting year of the crime data time interval
        startMonth - the starting month of the crime data time interval
        endYear - the ending year of the crime data time interval
        endMonth - the ending month of the crime data time interval
        kodUtvaru - the string representing the department code. It conforms to the regular expression [0-9]{6}.
        Returns:
        the GetCrimeDataTask instance of an asynchronous task, which performs the actual data loading on a separate thread

      • getLocationManager

        private LocationManager getLocationManager()
        Gets the location manager to be used in this fragment to obtain location patches.
        Returns:
        the LocationManager instance

      • initLocationProvider

        private void initLocationProvider()
        Tries to select an appropriate location provider and obtain an initial location. The location providers are iterated in the following order: GPS, network provider, passive location provider. If the GPS provider is not on, the user is prompted in promptUserToTurnOnGPSAndWiFi() to turn it on. The first provider that is on is selected as a location provider and stored to mLocationProviderId. The initial location is stored in mCurrentLocation after being retrieved from any of the iterated providers.

      • isAnyTaskRunning

        public boolean isAnyTaskRunning()
        Called to check whether there currently is any logically running instance of the department code and name loading task or the crime data loading task.
        Returns:
        the boolean indicating the fact whether there currently is any logically running instance of the department code and name loading task or the crime data loading task
        See Also:
        isKodUtvaruTaskRunningOrPending(), isCrimeDataLoadingTaskRunningOrPending()

      • isCrimeDataLoadingTaskRunningOrPending

        public boolean isCrimeDataLoadingTaskRunningOrPending()
        Returns the information about whether there is a logically running instance of the crime data loading task.
        Returns:
        true if the is a logically running instance of the crime data loading task; false otherwise

      • isKodUtvaruLoaded

        public boolean isKodUtvaruLoaded()
        Returns the information whether the department code is loaded.
        Returns:
        true if the department code is loaded, false otherwise

      • isKodUtvaruTaskRunningOrPending

        public boolean isKodUtvaruTaskRunningOrPending()
        Returns the information about whether there is a logically running instance of the department code loading task.
        Returns:
        true if the is a logically running instance of the department code loading task; false otherwise

      • loadKodAktualnihoUtvaru

        private void loadKodAktualnihoUtvaru(Location location)
        Tries to start the department code loading task for the given location. The method starts the task only if there currently is no logically running instance of the department code loading task nor the crime data loading task.

        After the successful department code loading task creation onKodUtvaruTaskCreated() is called to notify about the department code loading task currently being in a logically running state.

        Parameters:
        location - the Location instance for which to load the department code and name

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(Activity activity)
        Called when the fragment is first attached to its activity. References to CrimeDataLoadingListener and KodUtvaruLoadingListener are set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the fragment's activity does not implement CrimeDataLoadingListener or KodUtvaruLoadingListener

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Prepares the crime data loading fragment for data loading and optionally restores its state from the savedInstanceState parameter.

        The fragment is set to be retained in between configuration changes so the data loading tasks don't need to be stopped when for example the user rotates the screen. If the data had been torn down and had his state saved, this state is restored. Also the location provider is set and the initial location is loaded.

        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - the bundle used to restore the save fragment state. Contains the data saved by the fragment before it has been torn down.
        See Also:
        restoreInstanceState(Bundle), initLocationProvider()

      • onCrimeDataLoaded

        protected void onCrimeDataLoaded(CrimeResultData data,
                     Location location)
        Called when the crime data is loaded by the crime data loading task. This callback method gets called when the mCrimeDataLoadingTaskHandler finishes the crime data loading and there had been some data retrieved.

        If the current location (mCurrentLocation) is too far from the location, the data is considered outdated and the department code load is requested. Otherwise the data is considered up-to-date and reported to the CrimeDataLoadingListener with the CrimeDataLoadingListener.onCrimeDataLoaded call. If this fragment is in the state between the call to Fragment.onDetach() and Fragment.onAttach(), the CrimeDataLoadingListener will be null and it's callback will not be called.

        Parameters:
        data - the CrimeResultData instance containing the crime data loaded
        location - the Location instance containing the department code location for which the crime data had been loaded

      • onCrimeDataLoadingCancelled

        protected void onCrimeDataLoadingCancelled(int startYear,
                               int startMonth,
                               int endYear,
                               int endMonth,
                               java.lang.String kodUtvaru)
        Called when the crime data loading task is cancelled.

        This callback method gets called by mCrimeDataLoadingTaskHandler when it's internal async task is cancelled.

        The most common reason why a crime data loading task may be cancelled is the user clicking the back button while there is a crime data loading task running or pending.

        If the current CrimeDataLoadingListener is not null, its CrimeDataLoadingListener.onCrimeDataLoadingCancelled is called.

        Parameters:
        startYear - the starting year of the crime data time interval used for crime data loading
        startMonth - the starting month of the crime data time interval used for crime data loading
        endYear - the ending year of the crime data time interval used for crime data loading
        endMonth - the ending month of the crime data time interval used for crime data loading
        kodUtvaru - the string representing the department code used for crime data loading

      • onCrimeDataLoadingError

        protected void onCrimeDataLoadingError(int startYear,
                           int startMonth,
                           int endYear,
                           int endMonth,
                           java.lang.String kodUtvaru,
                           java.lang.Exception taskError)
        Called when there had been an error during the crime data loading.

        This callback gets called by mCrimeDataLoadingTaskHandler when it encounters an error running the asynchronous crime data loading task. The error is reported in an Exception instance, containing the error description. Also this method gets the search criteria used for the crime data loading withinin the other arguments startYear, startMonth, endYear, endMonth, kodUtvaru.

        As with the other CrimeDataLoadingListener calls, the CrimeDataLoadingListener.onCrimeDataLoadingError only gets called when the CrimeDataLoadingListener is not null.

        Parameters:
        startYear -
        startMonth -
        endYear -
        endMonth -
        kodUtvaru -
        taskError -

      • onCrimeDataLoadingStarted

        protected void onCrimeDataLoadingStarted()
        Called before the crime data loading task actually begins its work on a separate thread.

        To be removed suggestion pending.

      • onCrimeDataLoadingTaskCreated

        protected void onCrimeDataLoadingTaskCreated()
        Called when the crime data loading task enters the logically running state.

        The crime data loading task is considered to be logically running when there is a reference set to a CrimeDataLoadingFragment.CrimeDataLoadingAsyncTaskHandler and the state of the enclosed async task is AsyncTask.Status.Running or AsyncTask.Status.Pending.

        If the current CrimeDataLoadingListener is not null, its CrimeDataLoadingListener.onCrimeDataLoadingTaskCreated gets called.

      • onCrimeEmptyDataLoaded

        protected void onCrimeEmptyDataLoaded(int startYear,
                          int startMonth,
                          int endYear,
                          int endMonth,
                          java.lang.String kodUtvaru)
        Called when there is an empty crime data result. This callback method gets called when the mCrimeDataLoadingTaskHandler finishes the crime data loading and although the data was retrieved, it was empty, that means null. This callback is passed the arguments which describe the search criteria used for the crime data loading for which there had been an empty result.

        This is reported to the CrimeDataLoadingListener with the CrimeDataLoadingListener.onCrimeEmptyDataLoaded call.

        Parameters:
        startYear - the starting year of the crime data time interval
        startMonth - the starting month of the crime data time interval
        endYear - the ending year of the crime data time interval
        endMonth - the ending month of the crime data time interval
        kodUtvaru - the string representing the department code

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        Standard fragment callback override to be called when this fragment is detached from its activity.

        The tasks are requested to be cancelled.

        See Also:
        cancelTasks()

      • onDetach

        public void onDetach()
        Called when the fragment is detached from its activity. References to CrimeDataLoadingListener and KodUtvaruLoadingListener are set to null.

      • onKodUtvaruEmptyDataLoaded

        public void onKodUtvaruEmptyDataLoaded(Location location)
        Called when the department code data loading finished but no data was returned.

        This method is called by CrimeDataLoadingFragment.KodUtvaruLoadingTaskHandler after it finishes the department code and name loading, but there had been an empty result.

        An empty result is generally considered to be an error, possibly due to a CrimeMonitor service error or a connection error. Also if the location had been outside the bounds of the Czech republic, there would have been no data to be returned.

        If the current KodUtvaruLoadingListener is not null, its KodUtvaruLoadingListener.onKodUtvaruEmptyDataLoaded is called.

        Parameters:
        location - the Location instance for which there had been an empty result

      • onKodUtvaruLoaded

        protected void onKodUtvaruLoaded(UtvarKodANazev kodANazevUtvaru,
                     Location kodUtvaruLocation)
        Called when the department code and name had been successfuly loaded.

        This method is called by CrimeDataLoadingFragment.KodUtvaruLoadingTaskHandler after it successfuly loads the department code and name.

        This method is passed the arguments that contain the result of the department code and name loading along with the location used to load the data (department location).

        If the current location is sufficiently close to the department location, the department location is considered to be up-to-date as well as the loaded data. Then if there is no department data currently loaded or if the loaded department code differs from the already loaded current department code, there is a department code change and the crime data needs to be reloaded for the new department code and the current time interval. If it does not differ, no data loading is initiated.

        If there is a live reference to KodUtvaruLoadingListener, its KodUtvaruLoadingListener.onKodUtvaruLoaded is called.

        If the current location is too far from the department code location, the department code location is considered to be out-of-date and the department code is reloaded for the current location.

        Parameters:
        kodANazevUtvaru - the UtvarKodANazev instance containing the loaded department code and name
        kodUtvaruLocation - the Location instance for which the department code and name had been loaded

      • onKodUtvaruLoadingCancelled

        public void onKodUtvaruLoadingCancelled(Location location)
        Called when the department code and name loading had been called.

        This callback is called by CrimeDataLoadingFragment.KodUtvaruLoadingTaskHandler after the department code loading task had been cancelled.

        If the current KodUtvaruLoadingListener is not null, its KodUtvaruLoadingListener.onKodUtvaruLoadingCancelled is called.

        The most common situation this happens is when the user pushes the back button on his or her phone. This triggers the cancellation of all of the currently running tasks.

        Parameters:
        location - the Location instance used to load the department code and name for

      • onKodUtvaruLoadingError

        public void onKodUtvaruLoadingError(Location location,
                           java.lang.Exception taskError)
        Called when there had been an error during the department code and name loading.

        This method is called by CrimeDataLoadingFragment.KodUtvaruLoadingTaskHandler after it encounters an error during the department code and name loading. An Exception instance with error information is provided and also a Location instance used to load the data for is provided.

        If the current KodUtvaruLoadingListener is not null, its KodUtvaruLoadingListener.onKodUtvaruLoadingError is called.

        Parameters:
        location - the Location instance used to load the department code and name
        taskError - an Exception instance containing the error information

      • onKodUtvaruLoadingStarted

        protected void onKodUtvaruLoadingStarted()
        To be removed.

      • onKodUtvaruTaskCreated

        protected void onKodUtvaruTaskCreated()
        Called when the department code loading task enters the logically running state.

        The department code loading task is considered to be logically running after this callback is received.

        If the current KodUtvaruLoadingListener is not null, its KodUtvaruLoadingListener.onKodUtvaruTaskCreated method gets called.

      • onLocationChanged

        public void onLocationChanged(Location location)
        Called when there is a location update from the current location provider. This method gets called only when this fragment is currently registered with the location manager to receive the updates. Activity registers the fragment to receive the location updates with requestLocationUpdates(). Unregistration is done with removeUpdates().

        If there is currently no department code loaded or the mCurrentLocation is sufficiently far ( MINIMUM_LOCATION_CHANGE_DISTANCE meters) from mKodUtvaruLocationLoaded, the department code loading task is started for mCurrentLocation.

        Parameters:
        location - the Location instance containing the current location update

      • onProviderDisabled

        public void onProviderDisabled(java.lang.String arg0)
        Not used.

      • onProviderEnabled

        public void onProviderEnabled(java.lang.String provider)
        Not used.

                   int status,
                   Bundle extras)

      • promptUserToTurnOnGPSAndWiFi

        private void promptUserToTurnOnGPSAndWiFi()
        Prompts the user to turn on the GPS location service.

      • refreshData

        protected void refreshData()
        Requests the crime data load for the currently used time interval.
        See Also:
        refreshDataForInterval(int, int, int, int)

      • refreshDataForInterval

        public void refreshDataForInterval(int startYear,
                          int startMonth,
                          int endYear,
                          int endMonth)
        Called to request the crime data load for the given time interval.

        Usually, this method is called by the owning activity after the user selects the time interval using a dialog.

        The crime data loading is only initiated if there is currently no department code and name loading occurring and the crime data is not loading already.

        If there is currently no department code loaded, the department code and name is initiated.

        If there already is a department code loaded, the crime data loading is initiated.

        The initiation of the crime data loaded is reported.

        Parameters:
        startYear - the starting year of the time interval to load the data for
        startMonth - the starting month of the time interval to load the data for
        endYear - the ending year of the time interval to load the data for
        endMonth - the ending month of the time interval to load the data for
        See Also:
        onCrimeDataLoadingTaskCreated()

      • refreshDataIfLocationHasChanged

        public void refreshDataIfLocationHasChanged()
        Called to request the department code load for the current location.
        See Also:
        loadKodAktualnihoUtvaru(Location)

      • removeUpdates

        public void removeUpdates()
        Unregisters this fragment as a location listener from the LocationManager.

      • requestLocationUpdates

        public void requestLocationUpdates()
        Registers this fragment with the LocationManager to receive the location updates. The current location provider is used to receive the location updates at the frequency of at most every MINIMUM_LOCATION_REFRESH_INTERVAL ms and when there is at least a distance change of MINIMUM_LOCATION_CHANGE_DISTANCE meters.

      • restoreInstanceState

        protected void restoreInstanceState(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called from to restore the saved dynamic state of this fragment.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - the Bundle with the saved dynamic fragment state
        Throws:
        ConfigurationErrorException - if the restored service base URL string is malformed
